title: PSA: Food can be hot enough to burn you and yet still seem edible. Be careful.
body:
I chomped a pizza fresh out of the oven yesterday, and I could tell it was hot, but I kept at it. Within less than a minute, I felt the surface of the roof of my mouth peeling away, and soon I was spitting blood. Even today, there's still pain and major visible damage.

The threshold at which food will feel too painfully hot to eat (making you spit it out) is a lot higher than the point at which food can burn your mouth. This creates a dangerous window where food will seem okay to eat and yet be capable of injuring you, and this window grows as your hunger increases. I'm not telling you to wait until every meal is stone cold, but do keep in mind that "just barely cool enough" doesn't cut it.
